abstract.text: Plasmid for the expression of the mature form of DENV type 3 (strain Philippines/H87/1956) core protein was constructed in a modified pET21b vector that had a stop codon upstream of the His-tag coding sequence. Core protein was expressed in E. coli BL21 (DE3) cells and purified by phosphocellulose (PC) column chromatography. In brief, E. coli cells were grown at 37 o C until A 600nm reached 0.35-0.5. Subsequently, IPTG (1 mM) was added to induce protein expression for 3 h. Cells were harvested and disrupted with a microfluidizer in buffer A, which contained 50 mM HEPES, pH 7.9, 1 mM EDTA, and 15% sucrose. Cell lysate was filtered through a 0.45 µm filter and applied to a PC column pre-equilibrated with buffer B, which contained 50 mM HEPES, pH 7.9, 0.7 M NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, and 5% glycerol. After washing the column with a large volume of buffer B, protein was eluted by 2 M NaCl-buffer B. Alternatively, the column was washed stepwise by 0.7 M NaCl-buffer B containing no urea to 8 M urea and then 8 M urea to no urea with a 1.25 M or 1.5 M increase or decrease in urea concentration at each step before the protein was eluted by the 2 M NaCl-buffer B. Fractions containing core protein were snap frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80 °C. Protein concentration was determined by Bradford assay. The protein was diluted with 50 mM HEPES, pH 7.9, 1 mM EDTA, and 5% glycerol to desired concentration prior to use and used as 10X stock. To control for host proteins that could potentially be present at a very low concentration, the same procedure was performed from E. coli BL21 (DE3) cells containing an empty pET21b vector. For circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy, the protein storage buffer was changed from 2 M NaCl-buffer B to 0.1 M NaCl-buffer B using an Amicon centrifugal device (Millipore) according to manufacture's protocol. The full-length NS5 protein of DENV-2 strain PL046 (DENV NS5) was expressed as a SUMO-fusion protein from E. coli. In brief, the His-tagged SUMO-NS5 fusion protein eluted from a Ni-column was treated with sumo protease. The released NS5 protein was separated from the His-tagged SUMO by Ni-column chromatography. NS5 protein was further purified by PC column chromatography followed by Sephadex G-100 column chromatography to near homogeneity. The helicase domain of the NS3 protein of DENV-2 strain PL046 (DENV NS3H) was expressed and purified as a His-tagged fusion protein as described [14]. NdAg, which contains the N-terminal 88 amino acids of hepatitis delta antigen, was purified by PC column chromatography as described [12].
CD spectra were recorded on an Aviv Model 400 CD spectrometer (AVIV Biomedical, Inc.). Measurements were done at 25 °C in a rectangular quartz cuvette of 2 mm path

body_text.text: length (AVIV Biomedical, Inc.) . Spectra were recorded in the 190-250 nm wavelength range with 1 nm increments intervals. Five scans were done for each spectrum, and the data were averaged and smoothed for baseline correction using the software provided by the manufacturer. Melting curves were recorded at 222 nm with a heating rate of 1 °C/min and measurements at one degree intervals.

Core protein (1 µM) was pre-incubated for 15 min at 25 o C in 10 µl buffer containing 50 mM HEPES, pH 7.9, 0.1 M NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, and 5% glycerol. Next, 2.5 µl of glutaraldehyde (Electron Microscopy grade) was added. After incubation for 5 min at 25 o C, the reaction was terminated by the addition of 2.5 µl of 1 M Tris-HCl (pH 8.0).
Samples were subsequently resolved on a 15% SDS-polyacrylamide gel, transferred to nitrocellulose paper, and detected by using anti-DENV-3 core protein polyclonal antibody.

T41 and B16 RNAs were purchased from Dharmacon. The B16 RNA was 5'-end-labeled using [γ-32 P]-ATP and T4 polynucleotide kinase. SL(+), SSL(+), SUBRZ, SUB1, SUB1m, SUB2, SUB3, SUB3m, RZL, and RZS RNAs were derived from the DENV genome but contain some modifications. SSL(-) is an antisense RNA of SSL(+). Detailed information concerning each RNA is given in Supplementary Information. These RNAs were synthesized using the MAXIscript in vitro transcription kit (Applied Biosciences) and PCR-amplified DENV cDNA as the template. RNAs were internally labeled by [α-32 P]-UTP during synthesis. Total cellular RNA was isolated from cultured BHK-21 cells using Trizol reagent (Invitrogen). Yeast tRNA was purchased from Sigma. Concentrations of labeled RNA were calculated from the radioactivity of RNA and the specific radioactivity of [γ-32 P]-ATP or [α-32 P]-UTP. Concentrations of unlabeled RNA were determined by measuring the absorbance at 260 nm. RNA was denatured at 95 o C for 5 min and cooled to room temperature before use. RNA secondary structures were predicted by Mfold program Version 2.3 [24].

Reactions were conducted for 30 min at 37 °C in 10 µl buffer containing 40 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.9, 0.1 M to 0.7 M NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.02% Ficoll, 0.02% polyvinyl pyrolidone, 2% glycerol, 1 unit/µl RNasin, and 40 µg/ml BSA. The reaction mixtures were mixed with 2.5 µl of the loading solution (50 mM EDTA, pH 8.0, 25% glycerol, 0.01% xylene cyanol, and 0.01% bromophenol blue) before gel electrophoresis.

Assay was performed in 10 µl buffer containing 40 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.9, 0.1 M NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5% glycerol, 1 unit/µl RNasin, and 40 µg/ml BSA. Details of the reaction conditions are described in the legend to Figure 2. Reactions were terminated by addition of one-tenth volume of proteinase K (1 mg/ml in 0.5% SDS) and incubation for 30 min. The reaction mixtures were mixed with 2.5 µl of stop solution (50 mM EDTA, pH 8.0, 2.5% SDS, 25% glycerol, 0.01% xylene cyanol, and 0.01% bromophenol blue) before gel electrophoresis.

RNAs were pre-incubated with protein. Trans-cleavage reactions were initiated by the addition of one-tenth volume of MgCl 2 and terminated by the addition of an equal volume of stop solution (90% formamide, 50 mM EDTA, pH 8.0, 0.005% xylene cyanol, and 0.005% bromophenol blue).
Detailed reactions conditions for Fig. 3C , 3D, 3E, and 3F are described below. RNAs were resolved on a 5% polyacrylamide gel containing 7 M urea and visualized by autoradiography.

For RNasin. Trans-cleavage reaction was then performed in the presence of 10 mM MgCl 2 for 30 min. The specific radioactivity of the RZS RNA was one-fifth of the specific activity of the SUB2 or SUB3 RNA. All reactions were performed at 37 o C. RNAs were resolved on a 5% polyacrylamide gel containing 7 M urea. 5'P and 3'P represent the 5'-and 3'cleavage products, respectively. SUB1 RNA contains nt #1-144 of dengue genome followed by two copies of flag tag coding sequence and the residue #5-24 of core protein gene. One G residue has been inserted to the 5'-terminus of dengue genome for efficient RNA synthesis by the T7 RNA polymerase, and the AUG initiation codon has been mutated to UCG to create a cleavage site of hammerhead ribozyme. SUB1 RNA (252 nt) has the sequence of 5'-GAGUUGUUAGUCUACGUGGACCGAC AAAGACAGAUUCUUUGAGGGAGCUAAGCUCAACGUAGUUCUAACAGUUUU UUAAUUAGAGAGCAGAUCUCUGucGAAUAACCAACGGAAAAAGGCGAGAAA UACGCCUUUCAAUAUGCUGGACUACAAAGACGAUGACGACAAGGAUUAUA AGGAUGACGAUGAUAAACGGAAGAAAGCCCGAAACACACCAUUUAACAUG UUAAAACGCGAGAGAAACCGCGUGUC-3', in which the hammerhead ribozyme cleavage site is in lower case letters, the 5'UAR region is underlined letters, the flag tag coding region is in bold letters, and the 5'CS region is in underlined Italic letters.
SUB1m RNA is a mutant of the SUB1 RNA that does not have the AUG initiation substituted by the hammerhead ribozyme cleavage site sequence.

SUB2 RNA contains nt #1-144 of dengue genome followed by two copies of flag tag coding sequence and the residue #5-51 of core protein gene. Three G residue has been inserted to the 5'-terminus of dengue genome for efficient RNA synthesis by the T7 RNA polymerase, and the AUG initiation codon has been mutated to UCG to create a cleavage site of hammerhead ribozyme. SUB2 RNA (337 nt) has the sequence of 5'-GGGAGUUGUUAGUCUACGUGGACCG ACAAAGACAGAUUCUUUGAGGGAGCUAAGCUCAACGUAGUUCUAACAGUU UUUUAAUUAGAGAGCAGAUCUCUGucGAAUAACCAACGGAAAAAGGCGAGA AAUACGCCUUUCAAUAUGCUGGACUACAAAGACGAUGACGACAAGGAUUA UAAGGAUGACGAUGAUAAACGGAAGAAAGCCCGAAACACACCAUUUAACA UGUUAAAACGCGAGAGAAACCGCGUGUCGACUGUGCAACAGUUGACAAAG AGAUUCUCACUUGGAAUGCUGCAGGGACGAGGACCAUUAAGACUGUUCAU GGCCCUGGUGG-3', in which the hammerhead ribozyme cleavage site is in lower case letters, the 5'UAR region is underlined letters, the flag tag coding region is in bold letters, and the 5'CS region is in underlined Italic letters.

SUB3 RNA contains nt #1-250 of dengue genome except that the AUG initiation codon has been mutated to UCG to create a cleavage site of hammerhead ribozyme and has three G residue inserted to the 5'-terminus for efficient RNA synthesis by the T7 RNA polymerase. SUB3 RNA (253 nt) has the sequence of 5'-GGGAGUUGUUAGUCUACGUGGACCG ACAAAGACAGAUUCUUUGAGGGAGCUAAGCUCAACGUAGUUCUAACAGUU UUUUAAUUAGAGAGCAGAUCUCUGucGAAUAACCAACGGAAAAAGGCGAGA AAUACGCCUUUCAAUAUGCUGAAACGCGAGAGAAACCGCGUGUCGACUGUG CAACAGUUGACAAAGAGAUUCUCACUUGGAAUGCUGCAGGGACGAGGACC AUUAAGACTGUUCAUGGCCCUGGUGG-3', in which the hammerhead ribozyme cleavage site is in lower case letters, the 5'UAR region is underlined letters, and the 5'CS region is in underlined Italic letters.
SUB3m RNA is a mutant of the SUB3 RNA that does not have the AUG initiation substituted by the hammerhead ribozyme cleavage site sequence.

RZL RNA contains the 3'UTR of dengue genome (nt #10275-10723) and has an extra 25 nt sequence containing the central conserved sequence and the helix II of the hammerhead autocatalytic domain inserted into the upstream of the 3'UAR region. RZL RNA (473 nt) has the sequence of 5'-GAGGCAAAACUAAUAUGAAACAAGGC UAGAAGUCAGGUCGGAUCCAGCCAUAGUACGGAAAAAACUAUGCUACCUG UGAGCCCCGUCCAAGGACGUUAAAAGAAGUCAGGCCAUUACAAAUGCCACA GCUCGAGUAAACUGUGCAGCCUGUAGUUCCACCUGAGAAGGUGUAAAAAA CGGUUAGAGGAGACCCCUCCCUUACAAAUCGCAGCAACAAUGGGGGCCCAA GGUGAGAUGAAGCUGUAGUCUCACUGGAAGGACUAGAGGUUAGAGGAGAC CCCCCCGAAAUAAAAAACAGCAUAUUGACGCUGGUUAUUCCUGAUGAGGCC GAAAGGCCGAAACAGAGAUCCUGCUGUCUCCUCAGCAUCAUUCCAGGCAC AGAACGCCAGAAAAUGGAAUGGUGCUGUUGAAUCAACAGGUUCU-3', in which the 3'CS region is in underlined Italic letters, the 25-nt sequence containing the helix II and the central conserved sequence of the hammerhead autocatalytic domain is in bold letters, and the 3'UAR region is in underlined letters. RZS RNA is a 5'-truncated variant of RZL RNA, it contains the 3' terminal 146 nt of the RZL RNA and has three G residue inserted for efficient RNA synthesis by the T7 RNA polymerase. RZS RNA (149 nt) has the sequence of 5'-GGGCCCCCCCGAAAUAAAAAACAGCAU AUUGACGCUGGUUAUUCCUGAUGAGGCCGAAAGGCCGAAACAGAGAUCCU GCUGUCUCCUCAGCAUCAUUCCAGGCACAGAACGCCAGAAAAUGGAAUGGU GCUGUUGAAUCAACAGGUUCU-3', in which the 3'CS region is in underlined Italic letters, the 25-nt sequence containing the helix II and the central conserved sequence of the hammerhead autocatalytic domain is in bold letters, and the 3'UAR region is in underlined letters. was pre-incubated in 40 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 0.1 M NaCl, 0.02 mM EDTA, and 2% glycerol at 37 o C for 30 min. Cis-cleavage reaction was then performed in the presence of 6 mM MgCl 2 at 37 o C for 30 min. The reaction performed in the absence of MgCl 2 served as a control. The different RNA species were resolved on a 5% polyacrylamide gel containing 7 M urea. 5'P and 3'P represent the 5'-and 3'-cleavage products, respectively. Representative gels showing the annealing of SUB3m and RZS RNAs by different proteins. Two nM of each RNA was incubated with 25, 100, or 400 nM of the indicated protein at 25 °C for 15 min. Core protein (the refolded form), NS3H, NS5, NdAg, or the mock protein was used for the assay. Proteins in the reaction mixture were removed by proteinase K treatment. RNAs were then resolved on a native 5% polyacrylamide gel at 4 °C and visualized by autoradiography. The percentage of dsRNA formation was calculated and shown at the bottom of the autoradiogram.

BIBREF0.title: Representative gels showing the formation of T41/B16 dsRNA

BIBREF1.title: Assay was performed with 0.5 nM [ 32 P]-labeled B16 RNA, 0.75 nM T41 RNA, and 100 nM of core protein (the non-refolded form) or NdAg at 37 °C for the indicated period

FIGREF0.text: Fig. 3C, SUB1 RNA (0.1 nM) and RZL RNA (0.5 nM) were pre-incubated for 30 min with the indicated concentration of CP (non-refolded form) or NdAg in 40 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5) buffer containing 0.1 M NaCl, 0.02 mM EDTA, and 2% glycerol. Transcleavage reaction was then performed in the presence of 10 mM MgCl 2 . Reactions of SUB1 and RZL RNAs and CP but without MgCl 2 (lanes 1-5) and reactions with SUB1m and RZL RNAs, CP, and MgCl 2 (lanes 15-19) served as negative controls. For Fig. 3D, SUB1 (0.125 nM) and RZL (0.625 nM) RNAs were incubated with CP (400 nM) (lanes 1-5) or with the mock protein plus 50 µg/ml BSA (lanes 6-10) for 30 min. The samples were then extracted with phenol/chloroform (bottom panel) or not (top panel), and finally the cleavage reaction was conducted in the presence of 10 mM MgCl 2 for up to 90 min. For Fig. 3E and 3F, SUB2 or SUB3 RNA (2 nM each) and RZS RNA (2 nM) were mixed in the presence of 40 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) and 1 U/µl RNasin and incubated for 20 min. RNA mixtures were incubated for 30 min with 0, 25, 100, or 400 nM of the indicated protein in 40 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) buffer containing 50 mM NaCl and 1 U/µl

FIGREF1.text: Sequence of DENV-3 core protein.Twenty-four out of the one hundred amino acids of the core protein are arginine or lysine. Amino acids corresponding to the conserved hydrophobic region of flaviviruses are underlined.

FIGREF2.text: The effect of non-homologous RNA on SSL(+)/(-) dsRNA formation. Annealing of 2 nM of each RNA (400 nM in nucleotides) by 100 nM CP (refolded form) was performed in the presence of increasing concentrations of cellular RNA or tRNA at 25°C for 15 min. The reaction with mock protein served as the control. The molar ratio of the nucleotide concentration of the non-homologous RNA to that of the sum of SSL(+) and SSL(-) RNAs (i.e., 400 nM) was plotted versus the fraction of dsRNA formation.SupplementaryFigure S4

FIGREF3.text: The cis-cleaving hammerhead ribozyme construct SUBRZ. (A) The secondary structure model of SUBRZ RNA showing the 5'-3' interaction of DENV genome. The boxed region corresponds to the hammerhead ribozyme domain. (B) Representative gels showing the cis-cleavage of SUBRZ RNA. SUBRZ RNA (0.5 nM)

FIGREF4.text: Strand annealing assay with different proteins.

TABREF0.text: Supplementary Data SD2: RNAs of this study. T41 and B16 RNAs were used for the strand annealing assay. The T41/B16 dsRNA is a 5'-tailed duplex. SSL(+) and SSL(-) are complementary RNAs used for the strand annealing assay. SSL(+) RNA that contains nt #10633-10723 of dengue genome is a truncated variant of SL(+) RNA. SSL(-) RNA corresponds to the 3'-region of dengue genome in the antisense RZL, and RZS RNAs were used for the hammerhead ribozyme trans-cleavage assay. SUB3m and RZS RNAs were used for the strand annealing assay.

TABREF1.text: The size of the 5' and 3' cleavage products of different substrate RNAs.
